intro: Odontoloma boryanum, commonly known as the Boryanum toothbrush plant, is a member of the Asteraceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in a single head, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Odontoloma boryanum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and compact size.
